bug.short_desc: DNF does not allow to reinstall running kernel

long_desc.thetext:
Description of problem: My kernel was crashing during the boot, therefore I wanted to reinstall the package. However I found out that DNF is not able to reinstall running kernel. There is no --force or similar option available to override this artificial constrain.
I had to reboot the machine and choose older kernel, reinstall the kernel and then boot the latest kernel.
Version-Release number of selected component (if applicable): dnf-1.1.0-2.fc22.noarch
How reproducible: always
Steps to Reproduce: 1. run 'dnf reinstall kernel kernel-modules kernel-core'
Actual results: Error: The operation would result in removing the booted kernel: kernel-core-4.1.6-200.fc22.x86_64.
Expected results: DNF should not comply and reinstall it or there should be some option to override this. Ideally something intuitive ;)
Additional info: Guess what... :) YUM is able to do this without any complains
This issue is reproducable on newer versions of fedora, including 23, as well.

# sudo dnf reinstall kernel* Last metadata expiration check performed 0:20:56 ago on Tue Mar 1 09:55:18 2016. Dependencies resolved. Error: The operation would result in removing the booted kernel: kernel-core-4.4.2-301.fc23.x86_64.
# yum reinstall kernel* Yum command has been deprecated, redirecting to '/usr/bin/dnf reinstall kernel*'. See 'man dnf' and 'man yum2dnf' for more information. To transfer transaction metadata from yum to DNF, run: 'dnf install python-dnf-plugins-extras-migrate && dnf-2 migrate'
Last metadata expiration check performed 0:21:46 ago on Tue Mar 1 09:55:18 2016. Dependencies resolved. Error: The operation would result in removing the booted kernel: kernel-core-4.4.2-301.fc23.x86_64.
This package has changed ownership in the Fedora Package Database. Reassigning to the new owner of this component.
This bug appears to have been reported against 'rawhide' during the Fedora 26 development cycle. Changing version to '26'.

This problem cannot be reproduced with dnf-2.1.1_1-11g5af2514.fc25.noarch. DNF-2.1 was released for fedora26+. It can be installed from our testing repository for Fedora24+ ("dnf copr enable rpmsoftwaremanagement/dnf-nightly") Please if the problem can be reproduce with latest dnf versions (2.1 and newer), don't hesitate to reopen the bug report.
